title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: Drought-stricken farmers are being offered an extra $13 million to help improve water infrastructure on their properties, as the Treasurer wraps up his three-day drought tour. The money will be used to extend the On-Farm Water Infrastructure Rebate to the horticulture industry in addition to cattle producers. Fruit and vegetable producers, as well as vineyard owners will be able to use the funding to build bores and pipelines on their properties in a last ditch effort to keep their crops alive. Treasurer Josh Frydenberg said the government was weighing up its next move. Image: News Corp Australia
